elements.text: PART ONE
MUSIC: ROYAL THEME
1. THE GREAT SQUARE - BALCONY
FX. TRUMPETS SOUND.
CHEERS OF THE CROWD
(THROUGH ECHOEY PA SYSTEM)

My new wife and I thank you, the people of Cardenas for celebrating with us on this wonderful occasion. We are delighted to have shared this day with you, and we look forward to many happy days ahead.
CHEERS OF THE CROWD
(THROUGH ECHOEY PA SYSTEM) But first, my new husband and I have some private matters to attend to...
CROWD GOES BESERK AT THE SAUCY SUGGESTION
(THROUGH ECHOEY PA SYSTEM) (EMBARRASSED) Thank you, everyone, er, farewell, er...
(THROUGH ECHOEY PA SYSTEM) We love you all! (SHE BLOWS THEM KISSES)
FX. SEBASTIAN AND MIRANDA LEAVE THE BALCONY. WE CROSS STRAIGHT TO INSIDE.
DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
2. DUCAL BEDCHAMBER (CONT. )
FX. SEBASTIAN AND MIRANDA STEP OFF THE BALCONY AND CLOSE THE WINDOW BEHIND THEM. FROM OUTSIDE, THE CROWD CAN STILL BE HEARD CHEERING.
Well, it’s been a while since I saw the people as happy as that! Well done, darling.
I told you — everyone adores a love story.
Gracious, they’re still cheering for us — listen to them!
Cheering for us? You don’t really believe that do you?
What else would they be cheering for?
Oh, darling, sweet, naive, simple, Sebastian. They’re cheering for me.
The people love me. You’re the new arrival. I’ve ruled here for-
(INTERRUPTING) They are cheering. For me.
MUSIC: TITLES
DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
3. TARDIS CONSOLE ROOM
FX. TARDIS ATMOS. DOCTOR OPERATES CONTROLS.
.and then once it’s on its pre-programmed course, all you really need to do is monitor these readings, and she should find a suitable landing spot automatically.
Yes, I see. Not as complicated as you make out is it?
Well, that assumes everything goes according to plan. Learning to plot a course is one thing, Adric. Dealing with the unexpected — that’s another.
The unexpected? Like what?
Time fissures, Nyssa. Sub-space disturbances. Radiometric distortions. Artron fluctuations in the time rotor. Damp...
FX. TEGAN ENTERS.
And is that why we never know where we’re going? Because its: Starting £0: rot?
It is not starting to rot, Tegan. The TARDIS has just been around for a while and it’s, well it’s...
.a Clapped-out piece of junk that you have no idea how to operate?
FX. CONSOLE STARTS BLEEPING AND FIZZING. TARDIS LURCHES,
ROOM FILLS WITH GRINDING NOISE, LIKE A CRASHING PLANE.
DOCTOR/NYSSA/TEGAN/ADRIC: (RESPONSE SOUNDS TO TARDIS LURCHING AND CONSOLE SPARKING. )
I think she heard you!
Hang on to something. I’m going to try and land.
Doctor, let me help!
DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
Set the dynamic compensators to one one four, seven beta yellow.
One one four...
FX. SNAPPING SOUND.
(AWKWARD) Oh...
Have you done it? Adric! Have you done it!?
Not exactly.
What do you mean?
It came off in my hand.
Out of the way.
Tegan, what are you doing?
If I’ve learned one thing about flying this bucket of bolts, it’s this...
FX. SHE THUMPS THE CONSOLE. TARDIS LEVELS OUT.
It worked! Tegan's thump worked!
We’re landing.
But where?
(CHEERFULLY) I have absolutely no idea!
MUSIC: SEGUE.
DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
4. DUKE’S CHAMBERS
FX. THE DUKE SEBASTIAN IS PACING ON THE MARBLE FLOORS OF THE PALACE, TALKING TO HIS ADVISOR.
(FURIOUS) Have you seen the latest edition of The Cardenas Tribune, Amelia?
Your Grace, as I have counselled before, reading ill- informed speculation in the tabloids is a blueprint for misery.
Then why do we allow them to print it? Can we have their Correspondent-Royal imprisoned? He really is nauseating.
Your Grace will struggle to maintain his popularity if the people are not permitted to peek behind the ducal curtain.
But we can’t allow this to stand. We have to issue a response.
I do not advise that, Your Grace.
According to this article I am distracting myself from my broken marriage by (READS) "painting execrable water- colours, talking to bees and obsessing about the temperature of his morning toast."
Most upsetting and clearly inaccurate, but I worry that we give such stories more credence by responding.
Look, Amelia. What is the current mood of the court? Have any more livery masters made public their support for me? And the Guilds, do I have their support?
You do indeed, Your Grace.
Well, that's something I suppose.
DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
Two of them.
Two!? Please tell me they're the most prestigious ones? The Guild of Falconry perhaps? The Livery of Armour?
(RAPIDLY) The Guild of Seamstresses and the Livery of... Boiler-repair. But both are terribly enthusiastic — their love for you knows no bounds.
(MUTTERING, RESIGNED) Whatever “love” is.
I’m sure the rest of them will come around.
She’s put them up to this, hasn’t she? Trying to emasculate me through rumour.
I rather suspect the Duchess is behind this, yes.
Then your plan may well prove the best way forward. Is he here yet? Has there been any sign?
Not yet, Your Grace.
You will tell me the moment he arrives?
The Hadron Barrier sentries are primed and scanning, sir.
I shall have Cardenas back, Amelia. At any cost.
Yes, Your Grace.
DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
5. WOODS OUTSIDE THE PALACE
FX. TARDIS LANDS AND TARDIS DOOR OPENS, DOCTOR, TEGAN, NYSSA AND ADRIC EMERGE. THEY ARE IN MID-CONVERSATION.
So you’ve no idea where we are, and no way of finding out without going outside to take readings?
(A BIT WEARY) That’s right. Because it was an emergency landing — occasioned by your unwarranted violence.
What? That little thump stopped the sensors from working? How?
FX. TARDIS CREW STROLLS OFF.
The sensors are working fine, Tegan.
That’s how we know it’s safe to go out.
But unless we know exactly at what point we left the vortex...
It’s impossible to get an accurate fix on our location.
That’s crazy. On a seven-four-seven if everything else failed, you could at least rely on dead reckoning.
One of the many ways in which such craft differ, Tegan.
So where are we? This forest looks like an Earth forest. But I can't see any buildings or hear any traffic or planes. So when are we? On Earth? The Middle Ages?
No, I don’t think so...
Doctor — there’s something rather odd here.
I wondered when one of you would notice it.
DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
The yellow line, painted on the grass.
Yes. Strange isn’t it? Sprawling woods for miles and miles, and yet someone has gone to the trouble of painting a line right the way through it.
It seems perfectly straight. I can’t see a single bend.
What do you think it means?
I’m not sure. Painting a line that straight and true over uneven terrain like this would require something rather more sophisticated then you'd find in the Middle Ages.
FX. A FLOATING PLATFORM “BATTLE SCULLER” APPROACHES FROM A DISTANCE.
What — really? They did build castles back then you know.
Yes, Tegan, but...
I’d say it’s an awful lot harder to build a great big castle then to splash a bit of paint on some grass.
It’s not the size, Tegan, it’s the accuracy that’s interesting.
Tell that to the Romans. Amyway, maybe it’s a theme park?
Do theme parks need hovering platforms, with large laser rifles built into them?
Don't be ridiculous — (SPOTS THE SCULLER) Oh!
FX. BATTLE SCULLER COMES TO A HALT, FLOATING ABOVE THEM.
(CALLING UP AT THE CRAFT) Hello! I’m the Doctor.
DUCHESS’S GUARD: (CALLING DOWN) Halt in the name of the Duchess Miranda and surrender immediately!
DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
Or else what?
FX. LASER BOLT FIRES, HITS A TREE WITH A CRACK OF WOOD.
TOPPLES OVER, CRASHING NOISILY TO THE EARTH.
BEAT
We surrender.
10 DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
6. DUCHESS’S CHAMBERS
FX. THE DUCHESS MIRANDA IS PACING ON THE MARBLE FLOORS OF THE PALACE. THE DOOR OPENS AND TOMEK ENTERS. MIRANDA
PACING.
Tomek, there you are. What news?
Bad, your Grace.
FX. SHUTS THE DOOR AND APPROACHES MIRANDA.
The Duke won’t sign the Letters Patent.
Who’s your source?
Your Third Lady of the Bedchamber had lunch with the Duke’s Fourth Equerry of Foot.
Why is a Lady of my Bedchamber having lunch with one of the Duke’s low-rent minions?
He's her husband.
Right, well I suppose I should get court gossip from wherever I can.
The Duke was overheard saying that he would rather chew off his own foot than grant you the title of (READS) "Grand Margravine of Lox in... the County of Windlesham... in the Duchy of Cardenas."
Tomek, every Duchess of Cardenas for centuries has been granted that title on the first anniversary of their marriage.
Well, it is only a courtesy title, Your Grace. The population’s just two hundred. Most of them are cattle.
DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky

That's beside the point! He's withholding the Letters Patent to humiliate me. And if there is no legal way of addressing this, I will tell my father, who will underline the argument with a flotilla of battle- scullers.
FX. TOMEK’S COMMUNICATOR BLEEPS.
Forgive me, Your Grace.
FX. HE PRESSES A BUTTON TO ANSWER THE CALL.
(TO COMMUNICATOR) This is Tomek, report.
FX. INDISTINCT BURBLE OF THE HOUSEHOLD GUARD REPORTING.
(TO COMMUNICATOR) I see.
What is it now?
The Household Guard have found two people attempting to breach the Great Dividing Line. I don’t know why they trouble me with these things.
FX. MORE BURBLING.
A moment Your Grace. (TO THE COMMUNICATOR, SURPRISED)? Repeat that. They’re off-worlders?
FX. MORE BURBLE.
They’re off-worlders? Are you sure?
Off-worlders!? Tomek, have the Hadron Barriers been breached?
Impossible, Your Grace. We're impregnable.
12 DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
I suspect my husband’s hand in this, Tomek. I want you to interrogate these strangers personally. And don’t hesitate to have them executed if you suspect any malfeasance.
With pleasure, Your Grace.
FX. TOMEK ACTIVATES HIS COMMUNICATOR AGAIN.
Captain...
DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
7. WOODS OUTSIDE THE PALACE
FX. BATTLE-SCULLER CONTINUES TO HOVER. EXTERIOR ATMOS AS BEFORE.
DUCHESS’S GUARD: (INTO INTERCOM) Yes, sir. Understood.
There’s no chance this is a theme park? I mean the uniforms are pretty garish.
DUCHESS’S GUARD: (TO TEGAN AND ADRIC) You — prattling woman — and you — boy with the badge. You will come with me.
Why just us?
You crossed the line.
Oh come on, Doctor. All I said was I thought the uniform was garish.

No I mean literally crossed the line. See? You’re standing on that side of the line. Nyssa and I are standing on this side. (TO GUARD) Listen, we’re all members of the same party. Arresting half of us makes no sense.
DUCHESS’S GUARD: You're on the Duke’s side. Therefore you are supporters of the Duke.
I’ve never met him.
DUCHESS’S GUARD:
The Duke’s supporters are not my concern. However, fraternising with supporters of the Duke is my concern — it's treason. So these two will be taken to Her Grace’s cells.
Look, this has all been a terrible misunderstanding.
FX. THE DOCTOR MOVES FORWARD, THE GUNS ON THE SCULLER
SHIFT THEIR AIM TO HIM WITH A WHINE OF HYDRAULICS. LASER SHOTS RIP INTO THE TURF AHEAD OF THE DOCTOR.
14 DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
DUCHESS’S GUARD:
That was a warning shot. Put one foot over that line and the next blast will take off your head. (TO TEGAN AND ADRIC) This way, traitors.
Doctor, do something!
We can’t let them be taken!
Better go with them, Tegan. We’1ll catch up with you soon.
We'll be all right, Doctor.
FX. GUARD OPERATES A BUTTON, A HATCH OPENS AND A LADDER UNFURLS.
DUCHESS’S GUARD: Get on board the hover. Up the ladder and through the hatch.
FX. TEGAN AND ADRIC CLIMB UP THE LADDER.
Is it safe?
FX. GUARD COCKS HIS LASER PISTOL.
DUCHESS’S GUARD: Safer than refusal.
FX. TEGAN AND ADRIC REACH THE HATCH AND GO INSIDE. THE
ROLLS BACK UP AND THE HATCH CLOSES.
Tegan! Adric! We’ll find you. Don’t do anything stupid.
DUCHESS’S GUARD: Good advice.
FX. HE HITS A CONTROL ON THE BATTLE-SCULLER WHICH GLIDES AWAY WITH A SURGE OF POWER.
What now, Doctor?
I suggest we follow, at a discreet distance.
FX. DUKE’S GUARD APPEARS, OFF AND COCKS HIS LASER PISTOL.
15 DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky DUKE’S GUARD: (OFF)
(SHOUTING) Halt! Strangers! You have crossed the Great Dividing Line and are hereby arrested in the name of His Grace the Duke of Cardenas.
(SIGHS) Of course we are...
16 DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
8. DUNGEONS OF THE DUCHESS
FX. HEAVY IRON DOOR IS SWUNG SHUT AND BOLTED. TEGAN TAKES A FEW STEPS ON THE STONE FLOOR OF THE CELL.
The trouble with travelling with the Doctor is it’s twenty percent excitement, thirty percent having a gun stuck in your face and fifty percent being stuck ina dungeon.
You think it’s only fifty percent? I could doa regression analysis if you like...
This isn't funny, Adric.
BEAT.
Do you enjoy it?
Do I enjoy what?
Travelling. With the Doctor.
It does have its compensations, I suppose.
Travelling with me, you mean?
(HEAVY SARCASM) Oh yes, Adric, travelling with you is a real highlight.
(MISSING THE SARCASM) Oh good. For a moment there, I thought you'd lost your yo-yo.
Mojo, Adric, the word is mojo. (BEAT) Why is everything painted blue?
Is the colour scheme strictly relevant?
It’s just that everything is painted blue. If they like blue so much, maybe we could bribe them with the TARDIS.
17 DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
FX. ANOTHER DOOR OPENS, AND TOMEK ENTERS.
It’s azure. The colours of the Duchess Miranda. Are you loyal to the Duchess?
Would that be... a good or a bad thing?
The Duchess is the true ruler of Cardenas while the Duke is a gutless glob-chicken of a man whom all right- thinking people despise.
We can’t stand him, either.
God save the Duchess.
Commendable.
So, who are you, exactly?
I’m Tomek, chief courtier to the Duchess. And you’re the pair of strangers found plotting insurrection across The Great Dividing Line.
The line painted on the ground? We didn't know we weren't supposed to cross it. You should put up signs.
Then you really are off-worlders...
Perhaps. Tell us more.
When the Duchess realised the Duke’s many short-comings, the land was bifurcated. Split apart by the Great Dividing Line which runs right through the middle of the palace.
A separation that’s been enforced by paint?
DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
You really don’t know any of this? Sorry, but we don’t get many off-worlders on Cicero Prime. (HUSHED) Are you possibly...?
(HUSHED) Are we what?
(HUSHED) Are you agents of the Scorpion!?
(HUSHED) Who's the Scorpion? (NORMAL) And do we have to whisper?

(CLEARS THROAT) The Scorpion is an assassin, the most deadly of the Seven Systems. There are rumours that the Duke has contracted him to end his marriage, in a manner that might be cheaper than divorce.
Well, I can assure you, we have nothing to do with-

(TALKING OVER HER) Tegan, we need to take Tomek into our confidence. We are from the Grand Order of Alzarius. And as the Scorpion is contracted to deal with the Duchess, so are we contracted to deal with the Scorpion.
Adric.. really...
My badge signifies our Grand Order. Each sharp point is laced with poison. And that’s not all. I have deadly weapons concealed throughout my person.
Really? How inconvenient for you. Still, if you are as efficient and ruthless as you claim, the Duchess might have need of your services.
And — purely hypothetically — if we’re not?
Then I don’t imagine the engagement will last very long.
19 DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
9. DUNGEONS OF THE DUKE
FX. HEAVY IRON DOOR CLANGS SHUT. DUKE’S GUARD SHUFFLES OFF.
You see, Nyssa? Already my plan is working.
What plan!?
As soon as Adric and Tegan were taken, our best bet was to get captured too. Far quicker to get here on one of those sculler things than walking all the way to the palace ourselves.
Indeed. Only we seem to have beaten them to it.
Yes. I was expecting them to be locked up here with us.
(DOESN'T BELIEVE HIM) So, the "plan" was to get ourselves incarcerated in order to free Adric and Tegan. Even though we don’t actually know where they are.
(BEAT) Yes.
I don’t think much of the colour scheme. Why is everything red?
It’s either curiously unimaginative or deeply Significant. Perhaps it’s both?
Everyone’s dressed in armour, in a stone palace with iron bars. But, this is a high-technology civilisation. At least level five on the Meldrum Scale.
Some species just love nostalgia.
FX. DOOR OPENS. A GUARD AND THE DUKE APPROACHES.
DUKE’S GUARD:
Pray silence for His Royal Highness the Duke of Cardenas, Margrave of Lox in the County of Windlesham, Baron of the Lays, Great Silver Stick of State...
20 DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
(INTERRUPTING) Yes, yes, that’s enough, they’re prisoners not ambassadors. Now, my chief courtier tells me that we have some off-worlders visiting us. Would that be you?
I’m the Doctor and this is Nyssa.
Hello.
We were travelling with two other friends — Tegan and Adric. They’ve been taken prisoner too and we were wondering whether they were here?
Here? Oh, no, no. The Duchess’s doing. Her dungeons are on the far side of the palace.
You share a palace?
Off-worlders are not common on Cicero Prime. Who exactly are you?
FX. DOOR OPENS AGAIN AND AMELIA COMES HURRYING IN.
Your Grace!
Goodness, Amelia. Something wrong?
It is not seemly for Your Grace to conduct this interrogation alone. It is a breach of protocol!
Then what do you suggest?
I will summon the Lord High Magistrate who will have these strangers arraigned, tried, executed, buried and commemorated before the hour is out.
The Lord High Magistrate deals with petty criminals. What we have here are two off-worlders who have slipped past our Hadron Barriers without triggering a single alarm.
DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
(WHISPERING) Hadron Barriers! I told you there wasn’t a fault with the TARDIS.
(WHISPERING) Not now, Doctor.
(EXCITED) Amelia. Do you not recall our conversation of only two nights ago? Did you or did you not make contact with the, er, skilled gentleman that we discussed?
Skilled gentleman?
Your Grace, I sent word, but it’s too soon, surely?
Well, who else could it possibly be!?
What’s he talking about Doctor?

Of course, it’s him! The most feared assassin in the sector. And you’ve had him thrown in the cells? (TO THE DOCTOR) My Lord Scorpion, I beg your pardon. This has been a calamitous error. I implore you to show mercy.
Whoever you think I am, you’re quite mistaken.
You can drop the pretence. We’re the ones who contacted you.
Contacted us?
Yes, yes. To deal with my little.. matter. My... marital matter.
Your Grace...
I am right, though - you are The Scorpion?
No, I’m really not!
22 DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
(SIMULTANEOUSLY WITH THE DOCTOR) Yes, he really is.
I knew it!

He is The Scorpion. And I am his apprentice, Nyssa... The Destroyer. (ADOPTS, NOT TOO SUCCESSFULLY, THE PERSONA OF A KILLER) He kills for money. I murder because I like it. Now let us out of this rat-infested hell-box - or prepare to experience the most bloody consequences.
23 DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
10. CORRIDOR/DUCHESS’S GUEST QUARTERS
FX. THE DUCHESS MIRANDA WALKS ALONG A CORRIDOR WITH ADRIC AND TEGAN — THEIR FOOTSTEPS ECHOING ACROSS MARBLE FLOORS.
Tomek tells me that you have offered me your services?
We have, Your Grace.
Then I trust that these new quarters will be acceptable.
FX. SHE PRESSES A BUTTON. A DOOR BLEEPS THEN SWISHES OPEN. THE DUCHESS MIRANDA SHOWS ADRIC AND TEGAN THEIR NEW ACCOMMODATION. THEY ENTER AND WE FOLLOW.
It’s quite.. luxurious.
An extension I designed myself. The Duke loathed the plans. Called it a brutalist barnacle that would ruin the traditional sightlines of the palace. That’s why I insisted.
FX. TEGAN THROWS HERSELF ON THE BED.
I’ve always wanted a four-poster! It’s fantastic!
But only the one bed?
I assumed you two were also...
(QUICK) No, no, we’re not...
Definitely not...
I thought you said you travelled everywhere together?
Yes, but...
Not like that!
24 DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky

No matter the couch is serviceable. Now, we have much to discuss. Your arrival is well timed. There is a pageant this afternoon, a perfect opportunity I imagine for my useless husband and the vile assassin he has rumoured to have hired.
How long have you been married?
An age. One year today. Hence the joyous celebration.
A year? That didn’t last long.
The Duke is a crushing bore. A tedious hobbyist, whose focus on trivia has nearly driven the Duchy to bankruptcy. It’s not even as if he’s talented. A baby could paint better watercolours
Why did you marry him?

Because my father, Lord Crozion, insisted. We’re from Galleria. [PRO: GALLER-REE-UH] He moaned about the size of the dowry of course, but thought my marrying into a Dukedom would enhance our family prestige.
But the Duke is now determined to dispose of you?

According to my spies within his half of court, he’1ll try and make it look like an accident. Then the stiff, clumsy, unpopular Duke becomes a tragically heroic figure in mourning. While still keeping the dowry.
Don’t worry. We’ll take care of the Scorpion for you. Now, do you have any schematics of the palace?
You can access them from this view-screen here.
FX. SHE MOVES TO THE VIEWSCREEN, BLEEPS AND HUMMING OF
SCREEN AS MIRANDA BRINGS UP THE MAP FOR THEM.
25 DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
11. DUKE’S GUEST QUARTERS
FX. DOOR OPENS, SEBASTIAN SHOWS THE DOCTOR AND NYSSA IN.
These quarters should prove more salubrious.
They are tolerable, but we shall not be here long. Our only desire is to conclude our business swiftly.
Of course. Let me talk you through the ceremony planned for this afternoon.
I really must clarify something here...
(INTERRUPTING) Yes, my Lord Scorpion. I am as eager as you are to execute the vile sham-queen, Miranda.
Nyssa is a wonderful companion for you.
She certainly has a wonderful imagination.

I am so grateful to you for giving me the opportunity to cleanse my house of its spousal knotweed. Now, before the pageant begins, the Duchess will want to make a vulgar entrance on a large Stage Sculler from her side of the palace. That's when she will be most vulnerable.
Naturally. Now leave us. We must have time to prepare our deadly weapons of death.
Of course.
FX. HE LEAVES.
"Deadly weapons of death"?
26 DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
12. DUCHESS’S GUEST QUARTERS
FX. MIRANDA CONTINUES TO OPERATE THE COMPUTERISED MAP
BLEEPS AS SHE PRESSES BUTTONS.

That’s the Duke’s side to the west, decorated in gaudy rust-red. That’s my side to the east, in beautiful azure- blue. In the centre is the Great Square of Cardenas where the Royal Pavilion has been set up. That’s where we’1l view the Battle of the Equinoids.
Battle of the... what?
Equinoids — robot horses. We race them on special occasions. The people are almost as obsessed with studying their hydraulics as they are the bloodlines of the Royal family.
I see...
Before the race, I am to meet the Duke in the Royal Pavilion, just so we can be seen together in public.
Even though everyone knows you’re estranged?

(BECOMING PROGRESSIVELY MORE THEATRICAL) It’s the traditional protocol. Don’t worry though. I shall hold a little moue smile, doe my eyes and look wanly away from him. Then when the public realise a vile, grievous attack on my life has also just been thwarted... (STARTS SOBBING)
Try and keep yourself composed.

(BRIGHTENING INSTANTLY) Sorry, just preparing myself for interviews with the Correspondents-Royal. Now, the driver of the Stage-Sculler will set us down in the Palace grounds first so that you can deal with these assassins, using all the skills of the Order of Alzarius.
You may depend on it, Your Grace. We shall carry out your orders as if our very lives depended on it.
DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
Which of course, they do.
28 DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
13. DUKE’S GUEST QUARTERS
FX. DOOR HUMS SHUT. DOCTOR AND NYSSA ARE ALONE.
Nyssa, what on Earth do you think you’re doing!?
Trying to save our lives. Didn’t you hear what the Duke’s chief courtier said? He wanted to execute us. My plan is keeping us alive.
I would have thought of something.
But I did think of something Doctor. We pretend to be this Scorpion and his merciless companion.
A part you seem to be enjoying a little too much. "He kills for money. I murder because I like it"?
Verisimilitude. If we don’t make it convincing we’ll be executed and then Tegan and Adric will be stuck here forever.
Yes, yes all right. But you do realise that this plan requires us to actually assassinate the Duchess Miranda?
It requires us to look like we’re trying to. In the meantime, we’re free. We can move around the palace, find Tegan and Adric and then leave in the TARDIS.
We don’t have long. This carnival, or whatever it is, is happening this afternoon.
So we need a plausible plan to show the Duke. Any ideas?
(SIGHS) Assassinations are really not my specialty.
That floating platform we saw — the battle-sculler? What technology do you suppose that used?
Some kind of ionisation cushion I imagine.
DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
Does that work as well at smaller scales?
I see what you're thinking. Hmm. it could be done I
suppose. Maybe we could adapt this tele-console here...
FX. DOCTOR STARTS FIDDLING WITH CONTROLS.
DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
14. OUTSIDE THE DUCHESS’S GATE
FX. EXT ATMOS. A LARGE SCULLER HUMS IN READINESS. TEGAN AND ADRIC LEAVE THE PALACE.
Come on, now. We can’t keep my public waiting. Get on board.
We’re going in... that?
Of course! (ADMIRING IT) Twenty five tons of gold-plated floating platform with twelve footmen and a driver wearing an enormous ceremonial hat! Believe me, I know how to make an entrance.

So what was this plan of yours, Doctor?
70 DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
We worked with the Duchess's chief courtier to create a hologram of her — the Duchess — being assassinated.
The Duke wanted us to kill her and we needed him to believe that’s what we'd done — otherwise our lives were forfeit.
So, what’s gone wrong? How do you know the Duchess hasn’t just activated the hologram?
FX. THE DOCTOR HANDS TEGAN THE BINOCULARS.

See for yourself. There are scorch marks on the podium. Nyssa didn’t fire at her, but somebody did. And if they hit the Duchess before she could activate the hologram, then I’m afraid she’s already dead.
(LOOKING THROUGH THE BINOCULARS) She sure looks dead to me. I guess this puts an end to our plan.
Your plan?
It was pretty similar to yours actually. We persuaded the Duchess that we were assassins and that we could assassinate her assassins before they struck.
And before you ask — our lives were forfeit too.
FX. FOOTSTEPS APPROACHING FROM OUTSIDE.
Right, well, we have to keep up the pretence.
Which one?!
Both of them!
FX. DOOR OPENS, AMELIA ENTERS WITH GUARDS.

Nyssa the Destroyer of Traken...
Tegan the hand-maiden of death...

Adric, hunter of the damned...

NYSSA: No, wait a moment. Adric’s right. Sebastian believed that the Doctor and I were hired killers straight away — because Amelia said she had contacted off-worlders for him.

ADRIC: 99

DOCTOR: FX. DOOR OPENS.
DOCTOR: DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and
TOMEK: My Lady... hello, Your Grace.

TOMEK: even more

TOMEK: FX. HIS SHOUT SWITCHES BETWEEN HIS VOICE AND AMELIA'S ONE
PERSON: SHOUTING, JUST WITH DIFFERENT VOICES.
AMELIA: (SHOUT) NO!

DOCTOR: 102 DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
SEBASTIAN: Destruction? Of what?

DOCTOR: 103 DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
DOCTOR: 50. THE GREAT SQUARE
DOCTOR: FX. EXT ATMOS. TARDIS CREW STROLLING ACROSS THE SQUARE.
TEGAN: So it’s like a mask?
DOCTOR: Yes, but more sophisticated. The holo-disguise creates a fully three-dimensional image of another person. Very Similar technology to the hologram of Miranda on the podium, and just as illegal. Add a built-in voice filter and you have what appears to be two entirely different people.

ADRIC: Of course, there was never any reason for them to be.

LORD CROZION: (DISTANT) What do you and your rabble of reprobates want, young man?

DOCTOR: A word before you leave, Lord and Lady Crozion.
DOCTOR: 104 DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
LADY CROZION: Doctor, I’m grateful for your intervention, but my husband’s mind is made up.
ADRIC: But Lord Crozion...
LORD CROZION: Save your breath, boy! Diplomatic solutions have been exhausted. It’s time for the military to take over.
LADY CROZION: Our forces are quite terrifying. I'm hoping that Cardenas surrenders with only a few thousand dead — or at least before the death toll climbs into five figures.

DOCTOR: What is it, Nyssa?

DOCTOR: (MORE THOUGHTFUL) So it did.
TEGAN: So if Nyssa didn’t fire it...
ADRIC: Then who did?
DOCTOR: I've been a blind fool. Everybody inside — now!
DOCTOR: FX. ROAR OF ENGINES — AN ENORMOUS SHIP IS LANDING.
LORD: CROZION (SHOUTING TO BE HEARD OVER THE DIN) What in blazes is that?
LORD: 105 DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky
DOCTOR: (SHOUTING) It’s a Sting Ship. An interstellar craft from the Spadix system. The inhabitants are an unsavoury bunch. A gang of cybernetic thugs and villains, preying on neighbouring worlds. They specialise in assassinations.
LADY CROZION: (SHOUTING) What’s it doing here?
LADY CROZION: FX. SHIP LANDS, HATCH OPENS.
DOCTOR: I imagine your son-in-law sent for it.
DOCTOR: FX. THE SCORPION CLANKS OUT.
DOCTOR: Isn’t that right... Scorpion?
SCORPION: That's the Scorpion to you. Professional assassin par excellence. And when I am paid to carry out a hit, I always complete it. So produce the Duchess Miranda or I will kill you all where you stand.
SCORPION: END OF PART THREE

But what about you?

I know not. I know your people. You’ve been contracted for a kill. One kill. The Duchess Miranda. No one's paying you to waste ammunition on bystanders. Now, let’s see if we can’t come to some arrangement.
Your confidence is misplaced, 'Doctor'. Anyone who gets between me and my quarry, I shall also kill, and add the cost to my invoice.
The Duchess is no longer on Cicero Prime. I’ve made sure she is safe. Leave now and I’1l ensure you get paid.

Your pathetic lies were amusing for a while, I'1l confess I've been enjoying watching your little game. But time is money and enough is enough. I know that you haven’t had time to remove the Duchess from this world.
I assure you I have...

108 DW-MR-JAN2018 - Death and the Duchy by Robert Khan and Tom Salinsky

listen.

day, perhaps then we can discuss further terms. Right, that's long enough. I've wasted enough time here as it is.

TOMEK/AMELIA IS MUTTERING AWAY IN THE CELL. THE HOLOMASK IS DAMAGED, SO WE KEEP JUMPING FROM TOMEK TO AMELIA AND

FX. HOLOMASK SPARKS.

.after the Duchess had been slain. I would have advised him not to fly the flag at half-mast, for protocol’s sake. That would really have done for him. Mauled out of office by the hysterical populace.

OFF THE OUTSIDE OF THE THRONE ROOM.

FX. ADRIC PUSHES THE HEAVY DOOR OPEN.

I
